alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Somerset County through 515 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Princess Anne, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, West Pocomoke, Westover, Manokin, Upper Fairmount, Cokesbury, Upper Hill and Kingston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
